snippet: Some argued that if the allegations were true, the sins of the few should not ruin the lives of so many other Sayreville high school players, cheerleaders, and marching band members.
abstract: Arrests of seven football players from Sayreville War Memorial High School on accusations of hazing and sexual assault have divided New Jersey town where many residents thrive on football; school has cancelled football season, drawing approval from some and protests from others who argue that entire team should not be punished for transgressions of few.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and NATE SCHWEBER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jason Grant, Matt Krupnick, Vivian Yee and Amy Zerba, and research by Jack Begg.

lead_paragraph: Some argued that if the allegations were true, the sins of the few should not ruin the lives of so many other Sayreville high school players, cheerleaders, and marching band members.

headline.main: Sayreville High School Arrests Divide a Town That Lived for Football
headline.print_headline: Arrests Divide a Town That Lived for Football

keywords.value: Sayreville War Memorial High School (Sayreville, NJ)
keywords.name: organizations
